sentences.en: As chief executive, he assembled a polished stable of celebrities.
sentences.cn: 作为首席执行官，他手下云集了一批优雅的名人名士。

sentences.en: Each morning he shaved and polished his shoes.
sentences.cn: 他每天早晨都刮脸、擦鞋。

sentences.en: He is polished, charming, articulate and an excellent negotiator.
sentences.cn: 他文雅、迷人、能言善辩，是一名优秀的谈判人。

sentences.en: He polished off his opponents 21-2, 21-8 and 21-8.
sentences.cn: 他以21比2、21比8和21比8直落三局击败了对手。

sentences.en: He polished off his scotch and slammed the glass down.
sentences.cn: 他一仰脖喝完苏格兰威士忌，砰的一声把杯子放下。

sentences.en: He polished up the handle of the big front door.
sentences.cn: 他把大门的把手擦亮了.

sentences.en: I read her name on the polished brass plate.
sentences.cn: 我在擦亮的黄铜门牌上看到了她的名字.

sentences.en: It was simply a very polished performance.
sentences.cn: 这简直就是一场完美的演出。

sentences.en: The children loved sliding round the newly polished floor.
sentences.cn: 孩子们喜欢在新打光的地板上滑来滑去.

sentences.en: The silver will need to be polished up for the dinner party.
sentences.cn: 为了宴会,这些银器需要擦得光亮.

sentences.en: The wood had been recently polished to bring back the shine.
sentences.cn: 木头最近经过抛光又恢复了光泽。

sentences.en: They are available in polished brass, antique brass or silver-plate.
sentences.cn: 它们有哑铜的，古铜的和镀银的。

sentences.en: We polished and wore our second-best boots.
sentences.cn: 我们把自己次好的靴子擦亮后穿上了。

words.tran_cn: 磨光，擦亮；上光剂，擦亮剂；优雅，精良
磨光器；磨亮的人；[机] 磨光机
[机] 磨光；擦亮；修正（polish的ing形式）
擦亮（polish的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 磨光的，擦亮的，完美的，精良的，优雅的
trans.tran_en: done with great skill and style

trans.tran_cn: 使光滑，擦亮(polish的过去式和过去分词)
